cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR. 

This paper is likely to belong to the category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) as it deals with the task of sentence splitting and proposes a new corpus for the same. It also involves the use of natural language processing techniques. 

It could also belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) as the task of sentence splitting is a fundamental problem in natural language processing and is often tackled using machine learning algorithms. 

The sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) is also likely as the paper proposes a new dataset for developing sentence splitting approaches that learn how to transform sentences with a complex linguistic structure into a fine-grained representation of short sentences. 

The sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) is also possible as the paper may involve the use of neural networks for sentence splitting. 

Lastly, the sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) is also possible as the paper discusses how the proposed corpus can facilitate and improve the performance of downstream applications, which could include information retrieval systems.
